member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO
member.summary: TheHTTP_SSL_INFO structure contains data for a connection that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), obtained through the SSL handshake.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.ServerCertKeySize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the public key used to sign the server certificate.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.ConnectionKeySize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the cipher key used to encrypt the current session.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.ServerCertIssuerSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the string pointed to by the pServerCertIssuer member not including the terminating null character.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.ServerCertSubjectSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the string pointed to by the pServerCertSubject member not including the terminating null character.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.pServerCertIssuer
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated string of octets that specifies the name of the entity that issued the certificate.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.pServerCertSubject
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated string of octets that specifies the name of the entity to which the certificate belongs.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.pClientCertInfo
member.summary: A pointer to an structure that specifies the client certificate.

member.name: HTTP_SSL_INFO.SslClientCertNegotiated
member.summary: If non-zero, indicates that the client certificate is already present locally.
